page.title: 07WATER-STANELY RESERVOIR
page.content: The Stanely Reservoir came into service in 1838. It is 31 metres deep and covers an area of 46 acres. It is held in reserve to be used during water shortages. Stanely Castle, one of the local historic buildings, is within the boundary of the reservoir. It is an 'L' shaped structure. The exterior walls are well preserved but the inside is entirely gutted. The land on which the castle stands belongs to the Earl of Glasgow. The site of the castle and reservoir gives employment to a small group of local people. There are 2 youth opportunity workers and 4 full time employees. They all work a 38 hour week.One watchman is on night duty. There are a lot of trespassers in what is a dangerous place to play, and at least 2 children drowned recently.
